subject: Draft and Recruitment (Sports)
College Athletics
Hiring and Promotion
lead_paragraph: Indiana University’s president told the N.C.A.A. infractions committee that the hiring of the former Hoosiers coach Kelvin Sampson was “a risk that should not have been taken.” The president, Michael McRobbie, said during a private session on June 14 that Sampson had betrayed the university’s trust by violating N.C.A.A. recruiting regulations.
